trait.label: Mongol
trait.note: "C. Atwood note:Uriyangqad (singular: Uriyangqan) was/is a surname among the Mongols. Distinguish from “Uriyangqai” is a general term used by steppe Mongols for all forest peoples to the northwest (roughly Tuva, Altay Republic, Minusinsk Basin, etc.), and carries slightly pejorative implications of being cultural exotic and politically weak. The 合/哈 character at the end (the two are interchangeable in Yuan-era transcriptions, although not in Ming/Qing ones), would actually normally be capped by a diacritical –ti (惕 or perhaps 剔), for the final –d, which is usually omitted in common transcription. "
